subject: Deaths (Obituaries)
College Athletics
Football
lead_paragraph: Doc Blanchard, the 1945 Heisman Trophy winner who teamed with Glenn Davis at Army to form one of college football’s most famous backfields, has died. He was 84. Blanchard’s daughter, Mary Blanchard, told The A.P. late Sunday night that her father died of pneumonia at his home in Bulverde, Tex., earlier in the day.
